flawed_nl_solution:
If Emerie has six quarters, Zain has 6+10 = <<6+10=16>>16 quarters.
At the same time, Zain has 7+10 = <<7+10=71>>71 dimes, ten more than Emerie.
The total number of quarters and dimes Zain has is 71+16 = <<71+16=87>>87 coins.
Zain also has 10 more nickels than Emerie, a total of 10+5 = <<10+5=15>>15 nickels.
In total, Zain has 87+15 = <<87+15=102>>102 coins.
#### 102

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 17, not 71. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
